conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid from A is light blue and flows diagonally to the left.
The light blue liquid from A hits the red baffle and flows downwards.
The light blue liquid from A collects in container D.
Liquid from B is green and flows diagonally down.
The green liquid from B hits the white baffle and continues flowing down.
The green liquid from B hits the red baffle and flows to the right.
The green liquid from B collects in container E.
Liquid from C is pink and flows diagonally down.
The pink liquid from C hits the yellow baffle and flows down.
The pink liquid from C hits the red baffle and flows to the right.
The pink liquid from C collects in container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into D, from B into E, and from C into F.
